text: The Prussian National Assembly (German: Preußische Nationalversammlung), came into being after the revolution of 1848 and was tasked with drawing up a constitution for Prussia. It first met in the building of the Sing-Akademie zu Berlin (later the Maxim Gorki Theater). On 5 November 1848 the Government ordered the expulsion of the Prussian National Assembly to Brandenburg an der Havel and on 5 December 1848 it was dissolved by royal decree. ==External links== *Prussian Assembly Category:Politics of Prussia Category:German revolutions of 1848–1849 Category:1848 establishments in Prussia Category:1848 disestablishments in Prussia Category:1848 in politics
title: Prussian National Assembly
